The BI Survey 18 Analyzer

Survey results KPI Dashboard Product Dashboard Product Comparison Documentation

Survey Results

This screen shows the responses to a single question in The BI Survey. You can choose the question in the dropdown box in the top left corner of the report. The filters to the left of the screen can be used to modify the chart.

Question

Products

Region

Industry

No. of employees

User type

Country

Which department do you work in?

N = 2296

KPI Dashboard

The KPI Dashboard allows you to compare product results by criteria (KPIs). For each KPI, values are shown for all the products in the peer group selected in the peer group filter. The peer group average is displayed as a grey bar. All products displayed above the grey bar are above average in the peer group, and those below the grey bar are below average. At the top of the screen, you can choose which KPI and peer group to analyze.

KPI filter

Peer group filter

Product Dashboard

This report shows a summary of the KPI results for a single product. The dashboard displays the results for aggregated KPIs in bold and the root KPIs in regular. Simply select a peer group and product in the filters at the top of the screen. The product filter will only display the products in the selected peer group. The peer group filter will only display the peer groups in which the selected product appears.

Product filter

Peer group filter

Product Comparison

This screen allows users to make their own short list of products and compare them directly against each other based on multiple criteria. First select a peer group that you want as the basis for the product comparison in the filter. Then select the criteria (KPIs)you whish to compare. Multiple KPIs can be selected in this filter. Finally select the products you wish to compare.

Peer group

KPI

Product

About The BI Survey Analyzer

The BI Survey Analyzer web app is an interactive tool that enables you to perform your own custom analysis of The BI Survey 18 data. The app contains results from all the questions asked in The BI Survey 18. Product-related results based on a series of important criteria (known here as KPIs – Key Performance Indicators) are also available to view.

Peer Groups
  • Americas-focused vendors
  • Dashboarding-focused products
  • Data discovery-focused products
  • Embedded analytics-focused products
  • EMEA-focused vendors
  • Integrated performance management products
  • Large enterprise BI platforms
  • Large international BI vendors
  • OLAP analysis-focused products
  • Self-service reporting-focused products
Americas-focused vendors

Includes products from vendors that have a significant presence in - and focus on - the Americas region.

  • BOARD
  • CALUMO
  • Carriots Analytics (Envision)
  • Cyberscience
  • Dimensional Insight
  • Domo
  • Dundas BI
  • Looker
  • Phocas
  • Pyramid Analytics
  • sales-i
  • Sisense
  • Yellowfin
Dashboarding-focused products

Products that focus on creating advanced and highly sophisticated dashboards.

KPI Explanation
KPIShort explanation
Business benefitsThis KPI is based on the achievement level of a variety of business benefits.
Project successThis KPI is based on the implementation satisfaction level and the frequency of projects completed on time and on budget.
Project lengthThis KPI is based on how quickly the product is implemented.
Business valueThis aggregated KPI combines the ‘Business benefits’, ‘Project success’ and ‘Project length’ KPIs.
Price-to-valueThis KPI is based on how users rate their BI tool in terms of price-to-value.
RecommendationThis KPI is based on how many users would recommend the product to others.
Vendor supportThis KPI measures user satisfaction with the level of vendor support provided for the product.
Implementer supportThis KPI measures user satisfaction with the level of the implementer’s support for the product.
Product satisfactionThis KPI is based on the frequency of problems encountered with the product.
Customer satisfactionThis aggregated KPI combines the ‘Price-to-value’, ‘Recommendation’, ‘Product satisfaction’, ‘Vendor support’ and ‘Implementer support’ KPIs.
Self-serviceThis KPI is based on how many sites currently use self-service features with their BI tool.
FlexibilityThis KPI is based on how often the product was chosen for its flexibility, and on the frequency of complaints about user flexibility post-implementation.
Ease of useThis KPI is based on how often the product was chosen for its ease of use, and on the level of complaints about ease of use post-implementation.
Sales experienceThis KPI is based on how respondents rate the sales/purchasing experience with the vendor.
Data volumeThis KPI is based on the median volume of data in databases used with the BI tool.
Query performanceThis KPI is based on how quickly queries respond (adjusted by data volume).
Performance satisfactionThis KPI measures the frequency of complaints about the system’s performance.
Customer experienceThis aggregated KPI combines the ‘Ease of use’, ‘Self-service’, ‘Performance satisfaction’, ‘Flexibility’, ‘Data volume’, ‘Query performance’ and ‘Sales experience‘ KPIs.
Cloud BIThis KPI is based on how many sites currently use the product in a cloud environment.
Mobile BIThis KPI is based on how many sites currently use mobile BI with their BI tool.
Operational BIThis KPI is based on how many sites currently use real-time data from transactional systems with their BI tool.
Visual design standardsThis KPI is based on how many sites currently use visual design standards with their BI tool.
Location intelligenceThis KPI is based on how many sites currently use spatial/location analysis with their BI tool.
Visual analysisThis KPI is based on how many sites currently use visual analysis with their BI tool.
Data preparationThis KPI is based on how many survey respondents use data preparation.
Embedded BIThis KPI is based on how many survey respondents use embedded BI.
InnovationThis aggregated KPI combines the ‘Embedded BI‘, ‘Cloud BI’, ‘Visual analysis‘, ‘Mobile BI’, ‘Operational BI‘, ‘Location intelligence‘ and ‘Visual design standards’ KPIs to measure the product’s level of innovation.
Considered for purchaseThis KPI is based on whether respondents considered purchasing the product.
Competitive win rateThis KPI is based on the percentage of wins in competitive evaluations.
CompetitivenessThis aggregated KPI combines the ‘Considered for purchase’ and ‘Competitive win rate’ KPIs.
